title: Divisor topology
summary: In mathematics, more specifically general topology, the divisor topology is a specific topology on the set X = { 2 , 3 , 4 , . . . } {\displaystyle X=\{2,3,4,...\}} of positive integers greater than or equal to two.  The divisor topology is the poset topology for the partial order relation of divisibility of integers on X {\displaystyle X} .
